title: Abstinence-only-until-marriage programs and policies are a failure, research shows

title_detail.value: Abstinence-only-until-marriage programs and policies are a failure, research shows

summary: Abstinence-only-until-marriage programs and policies in the United States are ineffective as they do not delay sexual initiation or reduce sexual risk behaviors, two scientific review papers show. They also violate adolescent human rights, withhold medically accurate information, stigmatize or exclude many youth, reinforce harmful gender stereotypes, and undermine public health programs. Abstinence-only-until-marriage programs have been widely rejected by health professionals who care for young people.
